SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES_________________No. 18–1233_________________ROMAG FASTENERS, INC., PETITIONERv.FOSSIL, INC., et al.on writ of certiorari to the united states
court of appeals for the federal circuit[April 23, 2020]Justice Alito, with whom Justice Breyer and
Justice Kagan join, concurring.We took this case to decide whether willful
infringement is a prerequisite to an award of profits under 15
U. S. C. §1117(a). The decision below held that
willfulness is such a prerequisite. App. to Pet. for Cert. 32a.
That is incorrect. The relevant authorities, particularly
pre-Lanham Act case law, show that willfulness is a highly
important consideration in awarding profits under §1117(a), but not
an absolute precondition. I would so hold and concur on that
ground.
